title: Kyoto Maiden and Peeking Boy, one of a pair
marks:
Signature and Stamps

LL:. [ ?? ]
LLC: 
 LLC. [ ?? ]
text:
J'ry''s paintings of clean-cut beauties wrapped in luxurious kimono became very fashionable, and his influence can be seen in similar paintings even today. The left scroll represents a maiden from Kyoto, troubled that the hem of her robe is blowing in the wind, while the right scroll depicts a boy sneaking a peek, as though his powers of observation have stirred a wind strong enough to pry open her kimono.

(with 2013.29.111.1)
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
